content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    code_blocks = findall(String, md), begin
        start_line = line_number(md, start_string))
        end_line = line_number(md, end_string()))
        code_start <= end_line && start_line <= code_end
    end

    extracted_code = join(code_blocks, "\n")) # Join with newline
    return extracted_code
end
```
This function `extract_julia_code` takes a markdown document as input and extracts all the Julia language code blocks. It then removes the code fences and joins the code blocks together with a newline.

Note that this implementation assumes that `start_string` and `end_string` represent the typical syntax for code blocks in a Markdown document (e.g., triple backticks in GitHub flavored Markdown).
